content: दैवत {%<ab>a.</ab>%} (ती|{%<ab>f.</ab>%}) [देवता-अण्] {@--1@} Divine. {@--2@} (At the end of an adj. <ab>comp.</ab>) Honouring or worshipping as one's deity, as in सूर्यदैवता जनाः. --तं {@--1@} A god, deity, divinity; मृदं गा दैवतं विप्र घृतं मधु चतुष्पदं प्रदक्षिणानि कुर्वीत <ls>Ms. 4. 39</ls>, <ls n="Ms. 4.">153</ls>; <ls>U. 4. 4</ls>; <ls>Amaru. 3.</ls> {@--2@} A number of gods, the whole class of gods; <ls>Ve. 2.</ls> {@--3@} An idol. (The word is said to be {%<ab>m.</ab>%} also, but is rarely used in that gender. Mammaṭa notices it as a fault called अप्रयुक्तत्व; see अप्रयुक्त). {@--4@} <ab>N.</ab> of the third Kāṇḍa of Yāska's Nirukta.
